formattedAddress: 1082 Park Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1082 Park Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: I went to Dutch Girl Cleaners to have a rug cleaned. The price they quoted more than exceeded the value of the (cheap, secondhand) rug. However, when I told them this and turned to leave, the staff was very kind and helpful, informing me of how to clean the rug myself. I am most grateful for their able assistance and would consider Dutch Girl Cleaners for my future cleaning needs.

originalText.text: I went to the Dutch Girl Cleaners this morning to dry clean my two silk blouses, alter two other blouses. I was treated horribly by the old lady, Alexandra who was behind the reception desk. She didn't say hello to me, but I said good morning to her regardless, and told her what I planed to do. She asked me whether I cleaned my clothes before, and found me in the system, and put my order through. It's done quickly and motionlessly before I had a chance to tell her that I had a coupon. I mentioned it anyway, and was told it's too late. I suggested perhaps she could cancel the order, and re-do it with the coupon. She said no. Sure, I can always use it next time. So, I just told her to make sure to put the marks under the arm areas since she didn't do so before. She said yes, but didn't move. I thought she was busy, and would do it later since she'd agreed. I started waiting for the tailer. When it was my turn, the tailer was very nice and patient. We discussed all the details, and I asked her if it's ok for me to try the pinned blouses again with the bra since it's altered tighter than before. She agreed, and went out to talk with another customer. All the sudden, Alexandra impatiently asked me to be quick because another customer was also waiting for the tailer while I was changing. I immediately said sure, but felt uncomfortable. When I came out, I told her calmly that I didn't like the way she talked to me. She started arguing with me. At a point, I had to raise my voice to stop her talking to me. I accused her to be a racist, and asked her to get back my two silk blouses that I had ordered to be dry cleaned. She gave them back to me without any regret or hesitation. I didn't see the marks under the arm areas, and questioned her on that, but she won't let me finish my sentence, and started arguing with me again by saying the same thing, which was how much time I took with the tailer. I requested to talk to the store manager, and Alexandra said she's the manager. I left. I do not recommend this dry clean place to everyone simply because Alexandra proved to be a dishonest person, and she represent Dutch Girl Cleaners.

originalText.text: Love them. They are expensive but they don’t ruin your clothing like other dry cleaners. Never had an issue with them.

text.text: Love them. They are expensive but they don’t ruin your clothing like other dry cleaners. Never had an issue with them.
